Analysis of voting records: The expert may have examined the voting records of all members who served on the Intelligence Committee to verify if every member in both parties voted in favor of the claim related to NSA data collection.
Review of committee proceedings: The expert may have reviewed the official records or transcripts of the Intelligence Committee's meetings and discussions to verify if the claim was indeed made during those proceedings.
Cross: referencing with committee members: The expert may have contacted current or former members of the Intelligence Committee to verify if they recall the claim being made and if they voted in favor of it.
Examination of public statements: The expert may have analyzed public statements or interviews given by committee members to determine if they have publicly acknowledged and supported the claim about NSA data collection.
